title: Happy Birthday Seti@Home!
body: I can't believe it's been <a href="http://www.tomshardware.com/hardnews/20040521_170151.html" title="Happy Birthday! SETI@Home turns 5">5 years already</a>.  I mentioned <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/archive/2002/08/07/215.aspx" title="RedDiesel">awhile back</a> that <a title="Redwolves2" href="http://redwolves2.myftp.org/blog/" >Ralph</a> and I started a SetiTeam: <a href="http://setiathome.ssl.berkeley.edu/stats/team/team_147606.html" title="RedDiesel">RedDiesel</a>.  Feel free to use my <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com:5517/" title="SETI Proxy: travis.servebeer.com:5517">proxy server</a>.  It'll give you some <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com:5517/flashmap.htm" title="Flash map">nice</a> <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com:5517/chwu.htm?width=640&days=365" title="crazy stats">stats</a> as well as reduce the load on the main SETI servers.  Anyways, <a href="http://setiathome.ssl.berkeley.edu/download.html" title="Download SETI client">grab a client</a>, and get crackin' - <a href="http://setiathome2.ssl.berkeley.edu/fcgi-bin/fcgi?email=%64iesel69po%77er%40hot%6dail%2Ec%6fm&cmd=user_stats_new">you've got a long way to catch up</a>.
bodyArticleHtml:
2004-05-26

Happy Birthday Seti@Home!

I can't believe it's been
